title: Welcome to Masterblog
content: This is the very first post on Masterblog. Feel free to explore, create posts, and leave comments.
author: Admin

title: Why Flask Is Great
content: Flask is a lightweight Python web framework that gives you full control without unnecessary complexity.
author: Alice

title: Frontend Meets Backend
content: Connecting a JavaScript frontend to a Flask API is easier than it looks once you understand fetch and routes.
author: Bob

title: Keeping Code Clean
content: Separating frontend and backend logic helps keep projects maintainable and scalable.
author: Clara

title: Understanding REST APIs
content: REST APIs use standard HTTP methods like GET, POST, PUT, and DELETE to manage data.
author: David

title: Working with JSON
content: JSON is a simple and readable format that works perfectly for exchanging data between frontend and backend.
author: Eva

title: Debugging Tips
content: Using browser dev tools and Flask debug mode can save you hours when tracking down bugs.
author: Frank

title: Simple UI Matters
content: A clean and simple interface improves usability and makes your app more enjoyable to use.
author: Grace

title: Local Development Setup
content: Running frontend and backend on different ports locally is common and mirrors production setups.
author: Henry

title: Next Steps for Masterblog
content: Up next: comments, likes, and editing posts. The foundation is already solid.
author: Admin

title: Again??
content: Omg i posted again, that's crazy.
author: Joeran
